Hi David,=A0=A0=A0=A0 as a beginner, this sounds like a great idea.=A0 Some=
times I
read these postings=A0 going back and forth and it can be very diff=
icult
trying to understand. The more people like me can learn from people l=
ike
you, the better we'll all be in helping to preserve Nihonto.
=A0
Mark

Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Kantei


I have an additio=
nal suggestion.=A0 Perhaps each of those among us who collect
and study tsu=
ba might take the time to write a few paragraphs identifying
the particular=
 merits of, and reasons for collecting, a particular school.=A0
The really =
outspoken might go farther and identify a school, or type, of
tsuba they do=
 not collect, and explain why.

DZ=A0=A0=A0=A0
=A0 ----- Original Message -=
----
=A0 From: klepet33319
=A0 To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
=A0 Sent: S=
unday, March 12, 2006 3:42 PM
=A0 Subject: [nihontostudy] Kantei


=A0 I fo=
r one have enjoyed Jim's kantei(s).=A0 I am wondering if the other
=A0 memb=
ers concur and if they might like something like a regular kantei,
=A0 poss=
ibly Friday with answer on Sunday?=A0 Or bi-weekly? Perhaps we could
=A0 ge=
nerate a list of those interested in submitting their treasures with
=A0 on=
e member being chosen by Jim each week.=A0 Then that party could post a
=A0=
 picture with Jim giving his ideas at the close of the bidding.=A0 That
=A0=
 way he'd be on the hot-seat as well (although I think luke warm in his
=A0=
 case at best LOL).=A0 Just some thoughts.
